posts.name:
Matt Fok
Matt Fok
posts.content:
AI-Powered Networks: The Secret to Scaling Davos 2025’s Ambitions 

 Davos 2025 sets bold goals—AI ensures they don’t stall after the closing session.
Physical summits spark ideas. Virtual "DAVOS ""supercharges them with AI:

 Smart Matchmaking: AI algorithms connect climate startups with investors, NGOs with donors, and policymakers with grassroots data—instantly.
 Predictive Analytics: Anticipate crises (e.g., supply chain disruptions, outbreaks) using real-time global data streams.
 Networked Impact: Turn fragmented efforts into a unified force with AI-CRM tracking cross-sector progress.

The future of collaboration isn’t just hybrid—it’s intelligently connected.
posts.commentAdded: Exciting to see AI transforming collaboration at Davos 2025! Smart matchmaking and predictive analytics are game changers for impactful solutions.

posts.name:
Ronen R. Pessar
Ronen R. Pessar
posts.content:
How to grab attention in the first 10s of a cold call?

Psychology tells us the answer.

𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝟳-𝟯𝟴-𝟱𝟱 𝗿𝘂𝗹𝗲

When someone doesn't know if they should trust what they're hearing, they use NON-VERBAL cues.

 7% of people use the words to decide

 38% listen to how we sound

 55% look for body language

Without body language to look at on a cold call, 93% of prospects listen to how you sound, not what you say.

The key is to sound different in the first 10 seconds, and you'll earn more conversations!

This video is my top 3 cold call openers for 2025.

1 for each cold caller level:
→ newbie
→ getting good
→ elite cold caller

How to deliver each one.

Why they work.


Which opener works for you?
posts.commentAdded: Great insights! Mastering the art of tone and delivery can truly make a difference. Excited to try these openers and see the results! 🚀

posts.name:
Rajeeb Ghosh
Rajeeb Ghosh
posts.content:
𝗟𝗼𝘄𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗰𝗼𝘀𝘁𝘀 is crucial for businesses to improve their chances of survival and long-term success. By reducing expenses, companies can enhance profitability, maintain competitiveness, and allocate resources more efficiently.

𝗢𝘂𝘁𝘀𝗼𝘂𝗿𝗰𝗲 𝗡𝗼𝗻-𝗖𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗙𝘂𝗻𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 𝗖𝗮𝗻 𝗕𝗲 𝗔𝗱𝘃𝗮𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗴𝗲𝗼𝘂𝘀
Identify tasks that external providers can perform more efficiently and outsource them to reduce costs. Carefully select and negotiate with outsourcing partners to ensure cost-effectiveness and quality.

𝗜𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗳𝗹𝗲𝘅𝗶𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸 𝗮𝗿𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗴𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 to reduce overhead costs and attract top talent. Encourage employees to suggest and adopt cost-saving measures. Implement a cost-cutting culture within your organization and reward innovative ideas contributing to operational efficiency
posts.commentAdded: Great insights! Embracing flexible work arrangements and outsourcing can indeed drive efficiency and boost profitability. Lets innovate!

posts.name:
Kanhaiya Sati
Kanhaiya Sati
posts.content:
Bharat Mobility 2025 showcases the generational shift in Indian automotive innovation, driven by OEMs and suppliers investing in advanced R&D. It’s an overwhelming honor as a product manager at Forvia to see HELLA remain the preferred choice for OEMs in India, delivering cutting-edge lighting solutions.

With 125 years of expertise, HELLA exemplifies the fusion of innovation and experience—pioneering LED technology that enhances safety, offers premium styling, and ensures quality, all under a strong "Make in India" strategy.

Grateful to our customers for their trust—lighting isn’t just a product, it’s a science!

|
posts.commentAdded: Absolutely inspiring to see such innovation in the automotive sector! Congratulations to the HELLA team for leading the way in lighting solutions! 🚗💡
